de.esoco.coroutine

Class Coroutine.Subroutine<I,T,O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.coroutine.Coroutine<I,O>
        • de.esoco.coroutine.Coroutine.Subroutine<I,T,O>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.property.Fluent<Coroutine<I,O>>, org.obrel.core.FluentRelatable<Coroutine<I,O>>, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    Enclosing class:
    Coroutine<I,O>

    public static class Coroutine.Subroutine<I,T,O>
extends Coroutine<I,O>
    A coroutine subclass for the invocation of coroutines as subroutines in the context of another execution.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class de.esoco.coroutine.Coroutine

        Coroutine.Subroutine<I,T,O>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Subroutine(Coroutine<I,T> rCoroutine, CoroutineStep<T,O> rReturnStep)
      Creates a new instance that invokes the code of another coroutine as a subroutine and then returns the control flow to a step in the invoking subroutine.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void runAsync(java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<I> fExecution, Continuation<?> rContinuation)
      Executes this subroutine asynchronously in the given future and continuation.
      O runBlocking(I rInput, Continuation<?> rContinuation)
      Executes this subroutine synchronously in the given continuation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Subroutine

        public Subroutine(Coroutine<I,T> rCoroutine,
                  CoroutineStep<T,O> rReturnStep)
        Creates a new instance that invokes the code of another coroutine as a subroutine and then returns the control flow to a step in the invoking subroutine. The code of the original coroutine will be copied into this instance, not referenced directly.
        Parameters:
        rCoroutine - The coroutine to invoke as a subroutine
        rReturnStep - The step to return to after the subroutine execution

    • Method Detail

      • runAsync

        public void runAsync(java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<I> fExecution,
                     Continuation<?> rContinuation)
        Executes this subroutine asynchronously in the given future and continuation.
        Parameters:
        fExecution - The execution future
        rContinuation - The continuation of the execution

      • runBlocking

        public O runBlocking(I rInput,
                     Continuation<?> rContinuation)
        Executes this subroutine synchronously in the given continuation.
        Parameters:
        rInput - The input value
        rContinuation - The continuation of the execution
        Returns:
        The result of the execution
